channel.title: Time Out Singapore RSS API - Events
channel.description: RSS Feed from Time Out Singapore's Events

item.title: Japan Good Design
item.description: Fri 29 Jan - Japan’s inherent passion for good design is apparent in this exhibition marking the opening of the Japan Creative Centre in Singapore.

item.title: A*Mei
item.description: Fri 29 Jan - As Taiwan’s kooky, obscuro-pop diva Chang Humei embarks on her grand world tour, expect a polyrhythmic mix of alt-Mandopop and guitar-driven rock with performances of her chart-bothering favourites ‘Released’, ‘Nothing You Want After All’ and her most recent Beijing Olympics single ‘Forever Friends’.

item.title: Fafi at Adidas
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-30 Jan - Best known for her graffiti drawings of big-eyed, long-lashed girls, French artist Fafi is kickin’ it with Adidas to launch another take on the Originals line. Here, the artist has toned down the cartoonish, bare-breasted sex appeal of the characters she’s known to ink. Instead she plays up her other cheeky characters, the Fafinettes and Hmilos. For the girls only, the not-quite-high-tops hit the streets this month with the autumn and winter Originals collection. Pair these with a set of her leather hot pants ($149) – also a Fafi-Adidas tag-team collaboration – and you could practically be one of her graffiti stencils come to life.

item.title: $148 massages at Spa Park Asia
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-31 Jan - ’Tis the season to pamper yourself: Spa Park Asia’s latest promotion is called A New Year & A New You and promises two hours of pure bliss. At $148 (usual price $238), it comprises a lavender body polish, full body massage and a cleansing facial. It’s valid from now until 31 January so you can get prepped and look your finest for the festive season.

item.title: Toby and His Missing Paintbrush Holiday Workshop
item.description: 02 Nov 2009-29 Jan - Using a combination of storytelling and nifty science, this workshop follows the adventures of Toby. Participants are taught to interpret their observations and use these as starting points for their own creative expressions. Costs: $45; (five sessions per week) $195

item.title: Junior Assessment Package
item.description: 02-31 Jan - Wonder if your little one is a budding Picasso? You’ll find out soon enough when teachers assess their abstract works of art. No experience required. $75 for three lessons (includes materials). Ages 5 and above. #02-25 UE Square Shopping Mall, 81 Clemenceau Ave (6333 8203) Other location: #02-36/37 Bukit Timah Plaza (6472 0963)

item.title: Daisy Tan Netball Carnival 2010 Cup
item.description: 09-30 Jan - Both women-only and mixed teams compete for the champion’s trophy. Registration closes 6 Jan.

item.title: Sydney Festival, Australia
item.description: 09-30 Jan - Sydney is drawing back the curtains to spotlight its annual festival, a cultural extravaganza that transforms one of the world’s favourite playgrounds into a giant stage – more than 80 acts will perform, reveal and revel in designated streets, parks, galleries and concert halls throughout the city. Although the festival offi cially honours local talent, its well-earned reputation attracts acts like legendary soul singer Al Green, who will be performing on 11 and 12 Jan. +61 28 248 6500

item.title: Design Your Own Functional Clock
item.description: 15-30 Jan - Being able to watch time fly never looked this good, as kids learn to design a real ticker. Ages 5 and 62 Time Out Singapore January 2010 TimeOutSingapore.com Kids above. $30 (includes materials and lunch). #02-25 UE Square Shopping Mall, 81 Clemenceau Ave (6333 8203) Other location: #02-36/37 Bukit Timah Plaza (6472 0963)

item.title: Recent works - Ling Yang Chang
item.description: 15-31 Jan - Ling Yang Chang has been painting for more than 20 years, combining Western and Eastern mediums like acrylic, Chinese ink and rice paper. The beauty of nature inspires this local artist’s latest work.

item.title: The Singapore Short Film Awards
item.description: 25-31 Jan - A comprehensive, week-long retrospective of all the best short films produced in Singapore in 2009, with awards for best film, director, actor and more.

item.title: Room on the Broom
item.description: 27-31 Jan - This light-hearted play by Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler tells the story of a witch who invites one too many friendly animals to ride on her broom. Ages 3 and above. See ‘A clean sweep’.

item.title: A*Mei
item.description: 29-30 Jan - As Taiwan’s kooky, obscuro-pop diva Chang Humei embarks on her grand world tour, expect a polyrhythmic mix of alt-Mandopop and guitar-driven rock with performances of her chart-bothering favourites ‘Released’, ‘Nothing You Want After All’ and her most recent Beijing Olympics single ‘Forever Friends’.

item.title: BollyBlitz
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-01 Feb - Make like a Pussycat Doll and learn some slick dance moves at islandwide exercise franchise Amore Fitness. BollyBlitz is a new dance inspired by bhangra and infused with hip-hop movements. This high-intensity, low-impact top-to-toe cardio workout potentially burns as many as 500 calories a session. Available for Amore members only. Go to www.amorefitness.com for more details.

item.title: Eros Coaching
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-01 Feb - Searching for a Christmas gift that will simply blow his (or her) mind? How about amping it up under the sheets with sex coaching sessions conducted by clinical sexologist Dr Martha Lee? Book four sessions at $125 (usual price $150) per hour and then bask in the afterglow, knowing how easy it’ll be to get your other half to do the dishes all of 2010. Where: Chip Bee Gardens, 33 Taman Warna (6100 0851, www.eroscoaching.com). Take a taxi.

item.title: Vibrating Panties
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-01 Feb - These vibrating panties from Mr & Mrs Smith: The Couple Store sure make the perfect suggestive stocking filler. The sexy black stretch-lace panties have a secret pocket that keeps the remote-controlled vibrating bullet nestled snugly against your labia and clitoris. And thanks to the remote control, your hands are free to pursue other pleasures. Your partner can also add to the frisk factor by holding the power over your orgasms – via a remote from up to 3.5m away. The machine-washable knickers also come in a skimpier, sexy thong version.

item.title: Lemon Grass Massage Oil
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-01 Feb - Smother your partner in Fig Tea or Virgin Coconut natural oils and hope that you get something in return. Where: Lemon Grass House, #B1-26 Liang Court Shopping Centre, 177 River Valley Rd (6100 0807, www.lemongrass house.com.sg).

item.title: Persistent Visions
item.description: 04 Sep 2009-01 Feb - This 24-minute, three-screen installation draws on amateur audiovisual material collected by those affiliated to British colonising missions, and approaches archiving as a subject rather than a mere receptacle for facts and memories.

item.title: Orchid for Sale
item.description: 01 Nov 2009-01 Feb - A wide variety of orchids will be displayed for all orchid lovers to admire and purchase. Where: Library Courtyard, Botany Centre, Tanglin Core When: Every first Sun

item.title: Body Worlds: The Original & the Cycle of Life
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-06 Mar - Making its debut in Asia, the original anatomical exhibition from London, curated by Gunther von Hagens, features more than 200 human specimens. If you want to gain an insight into the human body, and the science of health and ageing, this exhibition bares it all. Costs: $20; children $12 (excludes admission fee).

item.title: Body Worlds: The Original & the Cycle of Life
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-06 Mar - Making its debut in Asia, the only original anatomical exhibition from London, curated by Gunther von Hagens, features more than 200 human specimens. If you want to gain an insight into the human body, and the science of health and ageing, this exhibition bares it all.

item.title: Quest for Immortality - The World of Ancient Egypt
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-04 Apr - Presented in this exhibition are 230 artefacts spanning from 4000 BCE to 950 AD. Besides reflecting the fascination and obsession the Egyptians had with the afterlife, this showcase also illuminates the intricate preparations made to ensure a smooth transition from this world to the next.

item.title: The Bag: Carrier bags in Singapore from the 1950s to the 1980s
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-18 Apr - With over 60 objects on display, this exhibition traces a creative metamorphosis from a time when paper bags were first locally made in the 1950s to the 1970s, before being replaced by plastic bags.

item.title: Bayanihan: The Spirit of the Philippines
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-30 Apr - The Singapore Philatelic Museum aims to capture the bayanihan or ‘warm communal spirit’ of the Filipino people in this exhibition. Flip through a vast stamp collection and interactive displays to find out more about this East-meets-West culture.

item.title: SINKID Velcro Tees
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-20 Feb - Be bold, selfless, forgiving, spontaneous: be whatever you want with SINKID’s black and white T-shirts on which you can Velcro whatever message you desire. Remember refrigerator magnet poetry? Same idea, but wearable. Costs: $19.90 (kids), $39.90 (adults).

item.title: ASEAN Basketball League
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-28 Feb - If you’ve been moping around the house and you find yourself casting wistful gazes over towards the Singapore Indoor Stadium every time you pass it by, then mope and wistfully gaze no more. It’s time for the inaugural ASEAN Basketball League and your chance to support the Singapore Slingers against the likes of the Thailand Tigers, the Brunei Barracudas, the Philippine Patriots and more. Apart from all the Space Jam-like action, season-ticket holders will also get a chance to vote for their favourite alternative team name. Go to the Slingers’ website for more details.

item.title: Bayanihan: The Spirit of the Philippines
item.description: 30 Nov 1999-30 Apr - The Singapore Philatelic Museum aims to capture the bayanihan or ‘warm communal spirit’ of the Filipino people in this exhibition. Flip through a vast stamp collection and interactive displays to find out more about this East-meets-West culture.

item.title: School visits by the Bird Park
item.description: 06 Nov 2009-06 Feb - Think of it as ornithology for the little ones as Dr Squawk, Jurong Bird Park’s resident expert, spreads his vast knowledge and little-known facts about all kinds of birds. Caw Caw.

item.title: Thrice Upon a Time: A Century of Story in the Art of the Philippines
item.description: 06 Nov 2009-14 Mar - What are the Philippines’ myths and legends? Who can tell the country's tales on her behalf? Thrice Upon a Time reinvents the notion of artist-as-storyteller. Spanning a century of art, this exhibition showcases works by Juan Luna, Fernando Amorsolo, Carlos ‘Botong’ Francisco, Ben Cabrera, Anita Magsaysay-Ho, Charlie Co, Jose Tence Ruiz, Poklong Anading and Rodel Tapaya. There'll also be a rarely seen painting by the Philippines’ national hero, Jose Rizal.

item.title: In the Eye of Modernity: Philippine Neo-Realist Masterworks from the Ateneo Art Gallery
item.description: 06 Nov 2009-14 Mar - This show traces the development of Neorealism art by Filipino artists in the 1950s to mid-60s who adopted a modernist approach through semi-figurative distortion and abstraction. This exhibition features post-war modernists including Arturo Luz, Vicente Manasala, Jose Joya, HR Ocampo and Cesar Legaspi. It's the largest ever overseas collection of artwork on loan from Ateneo Art Gallery.
